Sardar Patel Awas Yojana.details: A housing scheme launched by the Government of Gujarat to provide affordable housing to economically weaker sections and low-income groups. The scheme offers financial assistance for the construction of houses in both urban and rural areas.
benefits: Implementation in both urban and rural areas
eligibility: Belonging to economically weaker sections or low-income groups

Mukhya Mantri Awas Yojana (MMAY).details: A scheme announced to make urban areas slum-free by providing affordable housing to poor, lower, and middle-income groups. It focuses on providing low-cost homes to economically weaker sections (EWS) and lower-income groups (LIG).
eligibility: Belonging to EWS, LIG, or MIG categories

Gujarat Housing Board Schemes.details: The Gujarat Housing Board offers various housing schemes for different income groups, including LIG and MIG. Recent schemes include the development of housing units in cities like Surat and Navsari.
benefits: Affordable housing units for LIG and MIG
eligibility: Not owning any other property in the country
Not having applied for any other housing scheme from the state government

Affordable Housing Schemes by AUDA.details: The Ahmedabad Urban Development Authority (AUDA) offers affordable housing schemes for EWS and LIG categories in various locations like Bopal and Nikol-Kathwada.
benefits: Affordable housing units in designated areas
Focus on EWS and LIG categories
eligibility: Belonging to EWS or LIG categories

Housing Subsidy Scheme for Construction.details: Launched by the Gujarat Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (GBOCWWB), this scheme provides financial assistance to registered construction workers to help them purchase or construct their own homes.
benefits: Financial assistance for home purchase or construction
Focus on improving social and economic stability of construction workers
eligibility: Meeting criteria as specified by GBOCWWB

Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana - Gramin (PM.details: A centrally sponsored scheme aiming to provide a pucca house with basic amenities to all houseless households and those living in kutcha and dilapidated houses in rural areas by 2024.
benefits: Provision of pucca houses with basic amenities
eligibility: Houseless households or those living in kutcha/dilapidated houses in rural areas
Meeting criteria as specified by the scheme
